titlestmt.titleproper: Yale Graduate Student Union Records TAM.233
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-01-31T15:36-0500

change.item: Edited by Nicole Greenhouse to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Tamiment has no information on the donor of the collection. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.095.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2112. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Yale University graduate students / graduate teaching assistants attempted to organize labor unions in the 1980s-1990s. The two key organizations were the Graduate Employees and Student Organization, and the Graduate Student Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes GESO Voice: newsletter of the Graduate Employees and Student Organizations, notes from meetings, findings from a graduate student employee survey, newspaper clippings, research re: other graduate student attempts to organize, statements from the Graduate Student Union and officials from Yale University and a timeline of teaching assistant solidarity at Yale.
